content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Below is a Julia implementation defining a `struct` named `FloatWithUnits` and the corresponding `show` method to display instances of this `struct` in the desired format.

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, fu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, "$(fu.value) $(fu.unit)")
end
```

With this implementation, every object of type `FloatWithUnits` that is displayed will have its `value` and `unit` fields outputted in the format "value unit", such as "1.8 meters".
